definitions.definition_en: ( often  Commission )   [ ]  an  official  group  of  people  who  have  been  given  responsibility  to  control  sth ,  or  to  find  out  about  sth ,  usually  for  the  government （ ）  The  commission  is  expected  to  report  its  findings  next  month .  ( )   The  government  has  set  up  a  commission  of  inquiry  into  the  disturbances  at  the  prison . on  a  commission  the  British  representative  on  the  commission commission  on  sth  She  was  also  a  member  of  the  commission  on  religious  education .
definitions.definition_cn: 通常为政府管控或调查某事的 委员会 预计委员会将在下个月报告调查结果 。 政府成立了一个委员会来调查监狱骚乱事件 。 委员会中的英国代表 她还是宗教教育委员会的成员 。

examples.english: The commission is expected to report its findings next month .
examples.chinese: 预计委员会将在下个月报告调查结果 。

examples.english: ( BrE ) The government has set up a commission of inquiry into the disturbances at the prison .
examples.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会来调查监狱骚乱事件 。

examples.english: the British representative on the commission
She was also a member of the commission on religious education .
examples.chinese: 她还是宗教教育委员会的成员 。

definitions.definition_en: [ ]  an  amount  of  money  that  is  paid  to  sb  for  selling  goods  and  that  increases  with  the  amount  of  goods  that  are  sold commission  on  sth  You  get  a  10  per  cent  commission  on  everything  you  sell .  10%   He  earned  £2  000  in  commission  last  month .  2  000  on  commission  In  this  job  you  work  on  commission   ( =  are  paid  according  to  the  amount  you  sell )  .
definitions.definition_cn: 佣金 ； 回扣 你可从你售出的每件商品中获得 的佣金 。 他上个月挣了 英镑的佣金 。 你做这份工作按销售额提成 。

examples.english: You get a 10 per cent commission on everything you sell .
examples.chinese: 你可从你售出的每件商品中获得 10% 的佣金 。

examples.english: He earned £2 000 in commission last month .
examples.chinese: 他上个月挣了 2 000 英镑的佣金 。

examples.english: In this job you work on commission ( = are paid according to the amount you sell ) .
examples.chinese: 你做这份工作按销售额提成 。

definitions.definition_en: [ ]  an  amount  of  money  that  is  charged  by  a  bank ,  etc .  for  providing  a  particular  service （ ）  1  per  cent  commission  is  charged  for  exchanging  foreign  currency .  1%  commission  on  sth  The  bank  charges  a  high  commission  on  these  transactions .
definitions.definition_cn: 银行等的 手续费 换外币收取 的手续费 。 银行对这些交易收取高额手续费 。

examples.english: 1 per cent commission is charged for exchanging foreign currency .
examples.chinese: 换外币收取 1% 的手续费 。

examples.english: The bank charges a high commission on these transactions .
examples.chinese: 银行对这些交易收取高额手续费 。

definitions.definition_en: [ ]  a  formal  request  to  sb  to  design  or  make  a  piece  of  work  such  as  a  building  or  a  painting ;  the  fact  of  making  such  a  request （ ）  Eventually  she  agreed  to  accept  the  commission . commission  to  do  sth  He  received  a  commission  to  design  the  new  parliament  building .
definitions.definition_cn: 请某人作建筑设计或作画等的 正式委托 最后她同意接受委托 。 他收到设计新议会大厦的委托 。

examples.english: Eventually she agreed to accept the commission .
He received a commission to design the new parliament building .
examples.chinese: 他收到设计新议会大厦的委托 。

definitions.definition_en: 5 .  [ ]  the  position  of  an  officer  in  the  armed  forces ,  typically  with  the  rank  of   LIEUTENANT  or  higher （ ）
definitions.definition_cn: 通常指陆军中尉 、 海军上尉 、 空军上尉及以上的 军衔

definitions.definition_en: 6 .  [ ]  ( )   the  act  of  doing  sth  wrong  or  illegal  the  commission  of  a  crime
definitions.definition_cn: 做错事 ； 犯罪 犯罪

definitions.definition_en: available / not  available  to  be  used  Several  of  the  airline ' s  planes  are  temporarily  out  of  commission  and  undergoing  safety  checks .
definitions.definition_cn: 可 ／ 不可使用 这家航空公司有几架飞机暂时不能使用 ， 正在接受安全检查 。

examples.english: Several of the airline ' s planes are temporarily out of commission and undergoing safety checks .
examples.chinese: 这家航空公司有几架飞机暂时不能使用 ， 正在接受安全检查 。

definitions.definition_en: to  officially  ask  sb  to  write ,  make  or  create  sth  or  to  do  a  task  for  you （ ） commission  sb  to  do  sth  She  has  been  commissioned  to  write  a  new  national  anthem . commission  sth  to  commission  a  study / report  a  specially  commissioned  piece  of  music commission  sth  from  sb  The  king  commissioned  portraits  from  foreign  artists .
definitions.definition_cn: 正式委托 谱写 、 制作 、 创作或完成 她已受委托谱写新国歌 。 委托做一项研究 ／ 写一份报告 特别委托谱写的乐曲 国王委托外国艺术家创作肖像画 。

examples.english: She has been commissioned to write a new national anthem .
examples.chinese: 她已受委托谱写新国歌 。
委托做一项研究 ／ 写一份报告

examples.english: a specially commissioned piece of music
The king commissioned portraits from foreign artists .
examples.chinese: 国王委托外国艺术家创作肖像画 。

definitions.definition_en: 2 .  [ ]  to  choose  sb  as  an  officer  in  one  of  the  armed  forces … be  commissioned  She  was  commissioned  in  2014 .  2014  be  commissioned  ( as )  sth  He  has  just  been  commissioned  ( as  a )  pilot  officer .
definitions.definition_cn: 任命 为军官 她于 年被任命为军官 。 他刚被任命为空军少尉 。

examples.chinese: 她于 2014 年被任命为军官 。

examples.english: He has just been commissioned ( as a ) pilot officer .
examples.chinese: 他刚被任命为空军少尉 。
